conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C using pressure, volume, and work relationship.
The gas moves from state B to state C at a constant pressure of 0.6p0, with volume at state B as V0 and volume at state C as 0.5V0.
Identify the process from B to C as an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The work done in an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Determine the change in volume: ΔV = 0.5V0 - V0 = -0.5V0.
Calculate the work done using P = 0.6p0 and ΔV = -0.5V0, resulting in W = -0.3p0V0.
The negative sign indicates that work is done on the gas (compression).
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0V0.
